text_sections.section_2: Artificial intelligence is a rapidly growing field that is changing the way we live and work. As a result, there is a growing demand for professionals with experience in robotics and artificial intelligence in various industries.
text_sections.section_3: The Master degree program in Artificial Intelligence and Robotics provides students with the opportunity to develop advanced skills and knowledge in these exciting fields. They also learn to design, implement and evaluate complex robotic systems and artificial intelligence algorithms.
text_sections.section_4: Graduates of the program are equipped to pursue careers in a variety of industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, transportation, and entertainment. They are also ready to pursue research and academic opportunities in robotics and artificial intelligence.
text_sections.section_5: Not in the mood for a long search? Jump straight to the admission requirements (#admission-requirements) .
text_sections.section_7: Our close is one of the best in Germany. You will quickly get to know the professors personally.
text_sections.section_8: Our with small seminar groups and new forms of examination ensures digital and state-of-the-art university teaching.
text_sections.section_9: Develop a that aligns with through an individual : from key skills to research focus.
text_sections.section_10: Learn to cross disciplinary boundaries and discover in teaching and research.
text_sections.section_11: The is a hidden champion with diverse career opportunities and a high quality of life.
text_sections.section_13: A detailed overview of the can be found in the following PDF list: Download (https://www.utn.de/files/2025/02/2025_Semester_and_course_periods.pdf)
text_sections.section_16: Our innovative teaching and learning approach, rooted in extensive research, emphasizes active engagement and reflective practices. Rather than memorization-based learning, our approach entails undertaking learning-oriented assignments throughout the semester and receiving personalized feedback from faculty on your progress.
text_sections.section_17: The scientific core of your studies will be the essential content of your program. In the case of M.Sc. AI & Robotics, the following six base modules serve as your scientific core:
text_sections.section_20: The curriculum of the master program Artificial Intelligence and Robotics is a . Students will learn about problem solving, decision-making, and knowledge representation in AI, as well as the design and implementation of algorithms for autonomous robot navigation. They will study neural networks, training algorithms, optimization techniques, and applications in computer vision and natural language processing. Students will also learn about data analysis, statistical methods, data visualization, and data mining techniques. Through practical assignments and projects, they will gain hands-on experience in designing and implementing algorithms and systems in these fields.
text_sections.section_21: The unique highlight is the , an interdisciplinary scientific research project that focuses on practical learning experiences. The project aims to provide students with a scientific-based approach to solving real-world problems.
text_sections.section_29: You can always refer to the General Study and Examination Regulations (https://www.utn.de/studium/satzungen/) as well as the Aptitude Regulations (https://www.utn.de/en/about-us/legal-documents/) to read all admission requirements. Further information can also be found in our FAQ (https://www.utn.de/en/study/faq) .
text_sections.section_31: Join a new university and apply now for the Master’s program Artificial Intelligence and Robotics (M.Sc.)!
text_sections.section_33: If you have any queries regarding the M.Sc. Artificial Intelligence and Robotics degree program, please feel free to contact the student advisory service. We are more than happy to assist you!
